questions.question: What is the function of the centromere in a chromosome?
options: It divides DNA molecules.
It links sister chromatids and is essential for their separation during cell division.
It initiates DNA replication.
It serves as the chromosome's primary structural unit.
questions.answer: It links sister chromatids and is essential for their separation during cell division.

questions.question: Which part of a chromosome is known as the 'p arm'?
options: The shorter arm of the chromosome, located above the centromere
The long arm of the chromosome, below the centromere
The central region of the chromosome
A region containing repetitive DNA sequences
questions.answer: The shorter arm of the chromosome, located above the centromere

questions.question: What role do chromatids play during cell division?
options: They form the p arm and q arm.
They duplicate DNA independently of the chromosome.
They are copies of a chromosome joined together until they separate during mitosis or meiosis.
They act as binding sites for the centromere.
questions.answer: They are copies of a chromosome joined together until they separate during mitosis or meiosis.

questions.question: What distinguishes the q arm of a chromosome from the p arm?
options: It is the shorter arm located above the centromere.
It is the longer arm, typically below the centromere.
It has a higher concentration of centromeric DNA.
It is responsible for initiating DNA synthesis.
questions.answer: It is the longer arm, typically below the centromere.

questions.question: Which statement is true regarding the DNA molecule in chromosomes?
options: It is only present in the centromere.
It forms the double-helix structure within both chromatids.
It is only found in the q arm.
It is a single strand found in the chromosome's nucleus.
questions.answer: It forms the double-helix structure within both chromatids.

questions.question: During which phase of mitosis do chromatids separate at the centromere?
options: Prophase
Metaphase
Anaphase
Telophase

questions.question: What type of molecule is DNA?
options: Protein
Nucleic acid
Carbohydrate
Lipid

questions.question: How many chromatids are present in a chromosome after DNA replication but before cell division?
What is the role of the q arm in a chromosome?
options: It attaches to the cell membrane.
It contains genes that may code for proteins.
It initiates centromere formation.
It prevents chromosome replication.
questions.answer: It contains genes that may code for proteins.

questions.question: Where is DNA located within a chromosome?
options: Only in the p arm
Only in the q arm
In both chromatids
Only in the centromere
